name: Proposition Q
text:
We’ve wrestled hunger,/ Knotting itself in our empty mouths,/ We've begged hard with thirst/ Flaking our bloody lips.

/ So we’ve learned to grip life close.

/ In our walled-off streets,/ We ziptie flags/ To tentpoles with clenched teeth.

/ On gray dawns we line sidewalks/ To barricade against/ The red and blue siren bluster.

/ If we break,/ We stand up in our wake.

/ We roam untethered, / Build it all again/ Dispersed,/ But never dispossessed./
